result.execSummary:
The defendant Oakley C Kagigebi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 10:04 AM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Oakley C Kagigebi in court.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared via video for Oakley C Kagigebi.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of Information. Attorney Sebion indicates that an agreement has been reached.
Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Possession of Narcotic Drugs; Repeater. Repeater acknowledged.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant makes a statement to the Court.
Court sentences the Defendant to 5 Days of Jail with 5 Days of sentence credit, Court Costs/surcharges, DNA sample/surcharge.
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

(1:56 PM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Oakley C Kagigebi appeared by video. Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Oakley C Kagigebi. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Attorney Sebion to schedule an Arraignment with the Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing

2:07 PM Defendant Oakley C Kagigebi appeared in court, Attorney Carly June Sebion for Oakley C Kagigebi appeared by video, Attorney Andrew James Gunderson for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. State's witness was not available and Defense would like more time to speak with client as a waiver is being contemplated. 
Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
